Eclipse driver: 20040514

The code was the same as of 20040506.  There must have been a change in 
runtime or require on plug-ins you use.

Fixed.
I have released a fix to check for null on the offending line, returned from 
Platform.getBundle(pluginId); above.
Please verify in 4:00pm build or later.

Jeffrey, it would be good to know why it happened.  Theoretically a plug-in 
with unsatisfied requires should not be running.  Could you put a breakpoint 
in the old code and see what led the trouble of null?

Konrad, thanks much for handling this. Because of our current schedule, I need 
to ask if it's possible to get a patch for this fix that we could overlay on 
the 20040514 Eclipse M9 build (Win32 and Linux). Would this be possible? 
Thanks - Chris.

Konrad, thanks for the quick fix. Do you know when Platform.getBundle(...) will 
return null?

I think I just found out what the problem is... One of our dependencies has a 
plugin import statement that references a non-existing plugin. I'll open a 
defect against them, thanks again for all your help in debugging this problem!

The un-resolved plugin import actually uses the optional="true" attribute, so 
it is working as designed. So this brings back Chris's question:

Is it possible to get a patch for this fix that we could overlay on the 
20040514 Eclipse M9 build (Win32 and Linux).

As I wrote in comment #1, there was no code changes to the appserver plug-in 
in the last two weeks, until today.
Just get eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help.appserver_3.0.0\appserver.jar from 
I20040520 1600 build and you will get exactly this fix.

Jeffrey,
Thanks for veryfing the fix was incomplete.  I have patched the other place 
too and released into build.  Hopefuly still in time for the final M9 build.
There will be a build at noon that will absorb the change.
